definition: to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
surname Hu
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
beard/mustache/whiskers
see 衚衕|胡同[hu2 tong4]
to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

sentences.english: He had to fudge a reply because he didn't know the right answer.
sentences.chinese: 因为他不知道正确的答案，只好胡编乱造一个答案。

sentences.english: He had to fudge a reply because he didn't know the right answer.
sentences.chinese: 因为他不知道正确的答案，只好胡编乱造一个。

sentences.english: Edit an autobiography of a handsome man or a pretty woman as you like.
sentences.chinese: 给自己胡编乱造一个帅哥美女的自传。

sentences.english: Don't squander your time in reading those dime novels .
sentences.chinese: 不要把你旳时间浪费在读那些胡编乱造旳廉价小说上。

sentences.english: That is a timely idea, if only to lay Reed's fabrication to rest.
sentences.chinese: 要平息里德的胡编乱造，这是一个及时的举措。

sentences.english: I'm not interested in the adventure story which he whomped up.
sentences.chinese: 我对他胡编乱造的冒险小说不感兴趣。

sentences.english: Paul would say, 'Don't you think you're making this up?
sentences.chinese: 保罗说，‘你不觉得你是在胡编乱造吗？’

sentences.english: Raving of the reason was likeness to God, and doubt was sin.
sentences.chinese: 胡编乱造出道理是取悦神，而怀疑则是罪过。

sentences.english: Don't squander your time in reading those dime novels.
sentences.chinese: 不要把你的时间浪费在读那些胡编乱造的廉价小说上。

sentences.english: Andy spun out some drug list and quantity, cheat dunner.
sentences.chinese: 安迪胡编乱造出一些药品名单和数量，骗住了讨债人。

definition: random lies and falsehoods
to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
to fabricate (a story)
fabrication relying on nothing (idiom); frame-up
to fabricate/to make sth up/invented
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
gossip/hearsay/rumor
to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to make up/to fabricate
to speak without thinking/to blurt sth out
(coll.) to talk nonsense/to fool around
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
to talk random nonsense (idiom); to say whatever comes into one's head
to quote out of context (idiom)
